description: From Middle English schrouded, equivalent to shroud +â€Ž -ed.

adjectives.description: shrouded (comparative more shrouded, superlative most shrouded)

entries.meaning: Wearing, or provided with a shroud.
Concealed or hidden from sight, as if by a shroud.
examples: She wakened in sharp panic, bewildered by the grotesquerie of some half-remembered dream in contrast with the harshness of inclement fact, drowsily realising that since she had fallen asleep it had come on to rain smartly out of a shrouded sky.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of shroud
